# create_object { #databpy.create_object }

```python
create_object(
    vertices=None,
    edges=None,
    faces=None,
    name='NewObject',
    collection=None,
)
```

Create a new Blender mesh object.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name       | Type                                                                   | Description                                             | Default       |
|------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------|---------------|
| vertices   | [np](`numpy`).[ndarray](`numpy.ndarray`)                               | The vertices as a numpy array. Defaults to None.        | `None`        |
| edges      | [np](`numpy`).[ndarray](`numpy.ndarray`)                               | The edges as a numpy array. Defaults to None.           | `None`        |
| faces      | [np](`numpy`).[ndarray](`numpy.ndarray`)                               | The faces as a numpy array. Defaults to None.           | `None`        |
| name       | [str](`str`)                                                           | The name of the object. Defaults to 'NewObject'.        | `'NewObject'` |
| collection | [bpy](`bpy`).[types](`bpy.types`).[Collection](`bpy.types.Collection`) | The collection to link the object to. Defaults to None. | `None`        |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type                         | Description              |
|--------|------------------------------|--------------------------|
|        | [Object](`bpy.types.Object`) | The created mesh object. |
